p: In December 2019, coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) infected pneumonia caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) occurred in Wuhan, China with further worldwide transmission to a pandemic outbreak. An initial cluster of infections was linked to the Huanan seafood market, potentially due to animal contact [ 1]. Subsequently, human-to-human transmission occurred, and the disease rapidly spread to people around the globe. As of May 8th 2020, 3,907,055 patients worldwide have been tested positive for COVID-19 with a reported death toll amounting to 272,578 patients, and the numbers continue to rise [ 2].
